comment: Very fast paced, I recommend recording lectures and taking pics of slides and doing notes before coming to class. You do kind of have to teach yourself, lots of kahoots were played in class, but the work is relatively easy.

Get ready to play Kahoot and teach yourself. I get that you need to study, but what's the point of making class attendance mandatory if it's just to play Kahoots from chapters ahead and skip through 50 slides in 30 minutes?
I took her summer class it It was pretty good nothing really hard or anything.

I love Dr. M, her class is not hard to pass if you do your work and come to class. She does kahoots almost everyday that count towards your grades. She gives so much extra credit and all the test are online except for two. I recommend her!

Study and read the syllabus and you'll do fine. The class is point based so PLEASE understand that. Also no exams just quizzes...and 2 are in person. She actually cares. There are around 150 students and she knew my name personally from 1 teachers hour lol. She does respond to emails! Do take her! BUT ACTUALLY DO THE WORK
Great Professor

I took her my first semester of college, so I found this class hard. She was a good professor. It's lecture heavy and we did a kahoot every class. She does some group work. There are prep assignments due before every class so do those. If you come to class and do your work, you will be ok. She has no tests, just cumulative quizzes every week.

She's caring and wants you to do well. There are a lot of assignments but the class is point-based. Group projects were nice but sometimes a little unnecessary. My advice is to go to class as much as possible and go to the seminars. They're extra credit and really help to get your grade up.

Very passionate professor with engaging and easy to understand lectures. Although attendance isn't necessarily mandatory, you'll miss a lot of small grades/points that'll add up if you miss the daily in-class activities. Tests and quizzes are structured around the weekly online homework, so just keep do those, and you'll pass every assessment

She's a great professor. it's assignments and quizzes every week with lockdown browser no webcam. I wouldn't say attendance is mandatory but it is possible the more you don't show up the more points you miss. She does give tons of extra credit and there some group assignments but they're fun .
Very easy to make an A if you do your work on time. She gives out Superquizzes and quizzes every week, which can be taken at home. Offers a lot of extra credit opportunities.

very easy A. there's a weekly quiz & superquiz with lockdown browser/no webcam and about 2 homework assignments due every week as well as a kahoot every class. she's gives a lot of extra credit and the class is on the points based system so if you literally just show up to class and do the assigned work , you will pass.

She's amazing. There's weekly study modules and homework that are fairly easy. There's 1 quiz and 1 superquiz a week. 2 superquizes are taken in class for the midterm and final. Daily kahoots as attendance. Fun projects/experiments in class. Tons of extra credit. Really funny and caring person, I'd love to have her again.

I would take her again for the lecture. She does Kahoots in class, which can drop your grade if you do poorly on them or do not attend class because it will be an automatic zero. There are lots of extra credit opportunities, and there is group work. As far as a "big grade," there are no tests, only quizzes. She is excited to teach students.

No tests, only quizzes and HW. All online. You can get an A by pretty much just working at home. However, many points come from in class kahoots, which were defintely the worst part about the class. It would be like taking a quiz immediately after 100+ slides. She was super funny though and gave a lot of extra credit that was easy to get.
Loved her!! Enjoyed coming to lab and she always was super understanding if I was struggling or needed extra help. TAKE HER!!

One of the best profs I've taken at KSU. Lots of enthusiasm for the lectures, and plans a lot of cool activities. All of my friends who took the class would say the exact same. Any bad comments on this page are def just people who didn't listen/try at all in this class because she makes it very easy to do well. On top of all that she's super sweet
TAKE HER!! This class is an easy A. She assigned pre and post-quizzes that didn't require a webcam, only lockdown browser. Her lab worksheets are really easy and the labs are fun.
Highly recommend! She would make Kahoots and practice quizzes to help us prepare for the test. Very helpful in answering questions during class and during her office hours.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I enjoyed her class A LOT. She is such an amazing professor herself and her lab instructions in class are easy to follow. Her class was honestly minimum effort due to her being such a great professor. One pre and post lab quiz every week that must be done before class which are easy if you read and complete the lab worksheets. PLEASE TAKE HER!!

This professor is hands down the best professor for genetics!!! Not only does she make kahoots constantly to help study for the exams, she makes multiple study guide quizzes and gives extra credit on homework. This is very hard class to fail, I would study her powerpoints and study guides and get great grades for the exams. TAKE HER!!!!!!
i miss her she was so sweet
best biology professor
She is simply one of the best professors I have had. It was for bio lab, and I got an easy A. She made the material clear to understand was made the class bearable. Take her!
Dr. M is super sweet and caring. She genuinely cares about her students, when I had her for a lab class she made things so much easier to understand. I will definitely miss this class.

Sweetest little lady, very accommodating and nice. Had her for lecture and lab. Attendance isn't taken, but everyday an assignment will be given (90% of the time a kahoot). 2 quizzes a week, 2 homework assignemnts, all easy. Love her and will miss her :)

Usually I feel like labs are scary or sometimes painful to go to, but this teacher made everything so clear and was really good at answering my questions. Wish I had her for lecture because lab was awesome

This is the best prof I'v had so far, and I'd def take her again. If anyone on here says something bad about her it's just a dumb student who's petty about not getting a grade they wanted. This prof offered to meet with me multiple times outside class to make up work when I was having a tough time, and she was always super friendly and helpful.

She made lecture fun and exciting. A lot of my friends in other sections didn't get to do all the fun yet still educational activities we did, so I'm super glad I took her class. I feel like I learned a lot and would take again for sure
Loved this lab and learned a lot. She is always so helpful and encouraging

She teaches from PowerPoint. Daily kahoots as classwork assignments. Weekly tasks involve Pearson Mastery module and HW, a quiz, and a superquiz. She gives two attempts on quizzes and superquizzes. Lots of extra credit. Does some interesting class activities. The textbook is on Pearson. If you pay attention to the PPT's, you won't rly need the book

Be ready to come to every lecture bc kahoots are graded each class. Assignments every day it feels like but none are particularly difficult so its a good grading system. Great teacher, professor, person.
Took her for BIO Lab. Attendance is mandatory if you miss more than 2 classes you fail. Overall the teacher is nice and helps you but she does talk a lot lol

Great person, but not great at helping you understand the material. You have to do notes BEFORE class from PowerPoints that average 60-100 slides long. Weekly quizzes and homework, and daily grades that you have to be in class for. She doesn't go into depth and make sure people actually get the information. You basically teach yourself.
She is super sweet and very understanding. You can tell she loves what she's doing by her enthusiasm each day. She's understanding and lenient. I would definitely take her again if I could.

Amazing woman. She is so supportive and never fails to answer questions. She will give you try after try on pretty much anything and provides so much extra credit its crazy. The worksheets are he only "hard" thing and they are only 12.5pts each out of 1000 total for the semster.

I can appreciate her attempt at making a personal connection with her students. Because the class size was around 120, it made it difficult for her to do that. I think she'd be better off in a high school class than a college one. Quizzes each week and homework everyday.

Dr. Mueller Hill is very passionate about her labs! She was very helpful during the labs and made sure everyone understood what we were doing and understood the expectations. I would take her again for a lab!

very sweet. Super quizzes and quizzes are pretty easy. Quite a bit of online work through Pearson. My only thing I didn't like is the large amount of group assignments. Half the time your group wouldn't show up or nobody actually wanted to do the assignments. Sometimes in class assignments seemed like stuff you would do in high school.

Offered extra credit and would push back deadlines sometimes. Quizzes and super quizzes were "easy", just a bunch of memorizations. She gave a bunch of group work though, and you have to attend class since she gives a lot of graded class work that's due at the end of class. But she's nice and I'd retake her class 100%.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved her class. If you do the homework and show up to class she basically covers everything on the test. Tests are from home no lockdown, she gives you multiple attempts on quizzes and tests because she wants you to learn from your mistakes. Wish she was teaching 1108 cause I would take her again. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!

I was nervous at first to take a lab section with Dr. Mueller-Hill since she was new, but ended up being super grateful for it. She explains labs super well and easily so you actually understand the work you do in lab and its quick to get through. They were also fun and I looked forward to them which is weird for a class. Would highly recommend!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Really enjoyed class with this professor. I have taken other lab courses and lectures prior to Dr. Mueller-Hill's and never had an experience as good as hers. Biology can be a dense topic to learn but she is caring and enthusiastic and makes the class worth going to. Lots of fun activities that you also don't get in most other courses.

She is a wonderful person, but she talks a lot, especially for a lab! Usually takes one hour to get through pre-lab material but class and labs are not hard. Easy to get an A if you can sit through the pre-lab instruction!

Look man, I'll cut to the chase. She is a sweet person and honestly very enthusiastic about teaching so I tip my hat too her. However, there's A LOT of content to learn for just an INTRO CLASS, she reminds me of a sweet auntie who bakes pies (more then nelson can handle) overall solid teacher just  need to sharpen a bit more.
Super easy class if you do all the assigments easy A and people who say she gives alot of work it really isnt and dosent take super long.

She was caring, would respond to emails in a timely matter, and was always in a great mood. She would mention algorithms so we could remember the content being taught. Her group and hands-on projects were super good and creative I definitely recommend, stay on top of Pearson's work and teams and you will be fine. Tests were straightforward. Best!!

There were a lot of homework to get through each week along with one or two other quizzes to finish. All the homework were done on Pearson, which was annoying but it's a departmental thing. She is a sweet and enthusiastic about the topic, but I found her explanations and instructions a bit difficult to understand.
she was the best most materials were done online and only took one test in person if you miss an assignment its easy to make up. She is very sweet and funny.

I don't know what the other people we're talking about. She is a great professor who cares about biology. She wants you to do your best. The only thing is she gives a good bit of classwork/homework. It is nothing crazy hard though. I would take her if you can.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: This professor literally just reads a PowerPoint. Her class was so boring and made absolutely no sense. If you can take this class with a different professor, DO IT.
